cnd19:2.1: "I asked Sakyamuni twice": The Brāhmaṇa asked the Buddha and the Blessed One two
cnd19:2.2: times, but the Blessed One did not answer the question he asked (thinking) "In
cnd19:2.3: the middle, the roots of this Brāhmaṇa will become familiar." "Sakyamuni"
cnd19:2.4: Sakyamuni is a bhikkhu from the house of Sakya. This is Sakyamuni. Or, "the
cnd19:2.5: rich, the wealthy," this is also Sakyamuni. For him there are these wealth,
cnd19:2.6: namely: trusting wealth, abstaining from wealth, ashamed of wealth, hearing
cnd19:2.7: about wealth, giving wealth, wisdom wealth, mindfulness of wealth, righteous
cnd19:2.8: wealth, divine wealth, root wealth, strength wealth, enlightenment wealth, Path
cnd19:2.9: wealth, Fruit wealth, Nibbāna wealth, and use these various treasures as the
cnd19:2.10: rich, the wealthy. Or, those who are possible, those who are able, those who
cnd19:2.11: flow out all types of things, those who are sufficient, those who are heroes,
cnd19:2.12: those who are brave, those who are heroic, those who are not timid, those who
cnd19:2.13: are not frightened, those who do not run away, those who have given up fear of
cnd19:2.14: fear, those who have given up terror and fear. "I asked Sakyamuni twice": I
cnd19:2.15: inquired, begged, requested, and asked to make it clear to Sakyamuni twice.
cnd19:3.1: "[Like this Venerable Mogharāja]": "Like this," the continuation of the
cnd19:3.2: sentences, the connection of the words, the completion of the sentences, the
cnd19:3.3: combination of words, this is the order of the sentence, which is "like this."
cnd19:3.4: "Venerable," this is a synonym of love, respect, and obedience. "Mogharāja," the
cnd19:3.5: name, title, security of the Brāhmaṇa, title, word, phrase.
cnd19:4.1: "The all-seeing one did not answer me": "The one who has eyes did not answer for
cnd19:4.2: me," did not answer, tell, explain, teach, inform, establish, uncover, analyze,
cnd19:4.3: and clarify for me. Five types of eyes are those who have eyes: the naked eyes
cnd19:4.4: are those who have eyes, the heavenly eyes are also those who have eyes, the
cnd19:4.5: wise eyes are also those who have eyes, the eyes of Buddha are also those who
cnd19:4.6: have eyes, and all-eyes are also those who have eyes.
cnd19:5.1: How does the Blessed One regard the naked eye as "having eyes?" There are five
cnd19:5.2: colors in the eyes of the Blessed One: cyan, yellow, red, black, and white. The
cnd19:5.3: (Blessed One's) eye hairs are blue, extremely blue, correct, beautiful, and
cnd19:5.4: equivalent to flax, and the others are yellow, extremely yellow, golden, and
cnd19:5.5: correct, beautiful, the equal of the flower of the bayur tree. The two eyes of
cnd19:5.6: the Blessed One are red, extremely red, straight, beautiful, red as the insects
cnd19:5.7: that come from the ground after the rain, and in the middle are black, extremely
cnd19:5.8: black, not coarse, smooth, straight, beautiful, and moist. The outers are white,
cnd19:5.9: extremely white, white, yellow-white, pleasing, beautiful, and equivalent to the
cnd19:5.10: Osadhī star. With the naked eyes of the Blessed One which belonged to him
cnd19:5.11: naturally having been born of previous good kamma, he sees everything in day and
cnd19:5.12: night, when there are four branches of darkness: sunset, moonless night,
cnd19:5.13: darkness of the heavy forest, the darkness of heavy clouds. Like this, when
cnd19:5.14: there is the darkness of the four branches, he also sees everything in day and
cnd19:5.15: night. There are no walls, or shutters, or fences, or mountains, or bushes, or
cnd19:5.16: groves, which are obstacles to his vision of form. If a sesame is marked and put
cnd19:5.17: into a cart full of sesame, he can select that sesame. In this way, the Blessed
cnd19:5.18: One's natural naked eye is pure, and the Blessed One regards the naked eye as an
cnd19:6.1: How does the Blessed One regard the heavenly eye as "the one with eyes?" With a
cnd19:6.2: pure and transcendent celestial eye, the Blessed One sees that when all beings
cnd19:6.3: die and pass away, they are inferior, triumphant, beautiful, ugly, fortunate,
cnd19:6.4: and unfortunate, knowing that all beings flow according to their kamma: "These
cnd19:6.5: beings and monarchs have evil deeds of body, evil deeds of behavior, evil deeds
cnd19:6.6: of intention, rebuke the saints, wrong views and kamma of holding wrong views,
cnd19:6.7: they have passed away after death to the suffering realm, evil returning, lower
cnd19:6.8: realm, hell; or these beings, who have good deeds of body, good deeds of speech,
cnd19:6.9: good deeds of intentions, do not condemn the saints, and uphold the right view
cnd19:6.10: of the kamma, they have passed away to the world of goodness and heaven after
cnd19:6.11: death by disintegrating their bodies." In this way, with a pure and transcendent
cnd19:6.12: celestial eye, he saw that when all beings died and passed away, in the
cnd19:6.13: inferiority, victory, beauty, ugliness, fortune, and misfortune, he knew the
cnd19:6.14: flow of all beings according to kamma. When he wants, the Blessed One can see
cnd19:6.15: one world, two worlds, three worlds, four worlds, five worlds, and ten worlds.
cnd19:6.16: Also, twenty world realms, thirty world realms, forty..., fifty..., one hundred,
cnd19:6.17: these thousand small worlds, two thousand middle world realms, as well as these
cnd19:6.18: three hundred thousand great world realms [AN.3.81]. If he wants to, he can see
cnd19:6.19: it. In this way, the Blessed One's heavenly eyes are all pure, and the Blessed
cnd19:6.20: One regards the heavenly eyes as having eyes.
cnd19:7.1: How does the Blessed One regard the wise eyes as the one with eyes? The Blessed
cnd19:7.2: One is the great wisdom, broad wisdom, quick wisdom, sharp wisdom, piercing
cnd19:7.3: wisdom, advising wisdom: those who are skillful, those who have developed
cnd19:7.4: wisdom, those who have proved that they have reached the unimpeded, those who
cnd19:7.5: have reached the four fearless ones, those who possess ten powers, those who are
cnd19:7.6: like bulls, those who are like lions, those who can have great wealth, those with
cnd19:7.7: boundless wisdom, those with boundless brilliance, those with boundless fame,
cnd19:7.8: the rich, the wealthy, the guide, the moderator, the comforter, the informer,
cnd19:7.9: the one who makes it seen, the one who makes it visible, the one who makes it
cnd19:7.10: clear, the Blessed One is indeed the founder of the unborn Path, the producer of
cnd19:7.11: the unborn Path, the unannounced preacher; the one who knows the Path, the
cnd19:7.12: knower of the Path, and, (his) disciples now live in the Path's accompaniment,
cnd19:7.13: and will be the possessors in the future.
cnd19:8.1: The Blessed One is indeed the knower and seer, who knows and sees; he is the one
cnd19:8.2: who is born with eyes, born with wisdom, born with Dhamma, and born with Brahma;
cnd19:8.3: he is an interpreter and promoter of righteousness, the immortal giver, Dhamma
cnd19:8.4: King, Tathāgata; there is nothing that the Blessed One did not know, did not
cnd19:8.5: see, did not testify (prove), did not touch with wisdom; the past, the future,
cnd19:8.6: and the present came to the Buddha and the Blessed One with all the deeds in the
cnd19:8.7: field of wisdom, anyone with any name that should be guided to reason can know:
cnd19:8.8: one's own righteousness or others' righteousness or both, or the righteousness
cnd19:8.9: of the current life or the righteousness of the next life or both, or deep or
cnd19:8.10: hidden, or should be guided to infer, or have been guided to determine, or no
cnd19:8.11: fault or pollution, or clear or supreme interest, everything revolves in the
cnd19:9.1: All body kamma is transferred in the wisdom of the Buddha and the Blessed One;
cnd19:9.2: all language kamma...; all mental kamma...; the wisdom of the Buddha and the
cnd19:9.3: Blessed One about the past is barrier-free; ..future...; ...present...; all that
cnd19:9.4: should be guided to infer is the reach of wisdom; all wisdom is guided to be
cnd19:9.5: inferred, and all that should be guided to be inferred is the ultimate wisdom;
cnd19:9.6: the ultimate wisdom is what is guided to be deduced, and there is no wisdom
cnd19:9.7: beyond what is guided to be deduced; there is no way to transcend the wisdom
cnd19:9.8: that is guided and deduced. These dhammas live in mutual restriction, such as
cnd19:9.9: two boxes, where the covers are completely in contact; the lower cover does not
cnd19:9.10: go over the upper one, and the upper cover does not go over the lower one;
cnd19:9.11: restricted to each other. (Similarly, ) all that should be guided... (omitted);
cnd19:9.12: these dhammas live in mutual restriction.
cnd19:10.1: The wisdom of the Buddha and the Blessed One is transferred in all the Dhamma,
cnd19:10.2: all the Dhamma is the Buddha, the Blessed One's turning belongs, the hope
cnd19:10.3: belongs, the intention belongs, the mind arises, the wisdom of the Buddha and
cnd19:10.4: the Blessed One is transferred to all living beings, the Blessed One knows the
cnd19:10.5: intentions of all living beings, knows the potential tendency of troubles,
cnd19:10.6: ...the behavior, ...solution, about the less dusty, the more dusty; the rooted,
cnd19:10.7: the dull rooted, the good deeds, the evil deeds, and the teachability and
cnd19:10.8: unteachability of beings; capable and incapable sentient beings, including the
cnd19:10.9: world of heaven, demons, and Brāhmaṇa; generations of Samaṇas, Brāhmaṇas,
cnd19:10.10: heaven, and man all revolve in the wisdom of Buddha.
cnd19:11.1: If any fish, turtles, and even the big fish swallowing boats revolve in the sea,
cnd19:11.2: the same, including the world of heaven, the world of demons, and the world of
cnd19:11.3: Brāhmaṇa; the generations including Samaṇas, Brāhmaṇas, heaven and man are all
cnd19:11.4: turned around in the Buddha wisdom, such as any bird and even the gold-winged
cnd19:11.5: birds were turning around in the field of space. In the same way, those who
cnd19:11.6: possess the same wisdom as Sāriputta also revolve in the field of Buddha wisdom.
cnd19:11.7: The wisdom of the Buddha is pervasive and transcends heaven and human.
cnd19:12.1: Those wise khattiya, wise Brāhmaṇas, wise homeowners, wise Samaṇas, smart
cnd19:12.2: dissidents, sharp breakers who want to act on evil views with a wise attitude,
cnd19:12.3: they prepare problems to be seen later; they saw the Tathāgata and asked about
cnd19:12.4: the what is hidden and secret. Those questions were discussed and answered by
cnd19:12.5: the Blessed One with reasons, and they abandoned those (others) nearby and
cnd19:12.6: became the (disciples) of the Blessed One. At that time, the Blessed One was
cnd19:12.7: there, shining with wisdom. In this way, the Blessed One regards the insight as
cnd19:13.1: How is it that the Buddha's eyes are "the one who as eyes?" When the Blessed One
cnd19:13.2: observes the world with the eyes of the Buddha, he sees those with less dust and
cnd19:13.3: more dust; those with roots and blunt roots; ...good deeds and evil deeds;
cnd19:13.4: ...easy to teach and difficult to teach; the existing sins and terrors of the
cnd19:13.5: other worlds, others who do not live in seeing sin and terror in other worlds.
cnd19:13.6: Just like in the green lotus pond, red lotus pond, and white lotus pond, some
cnd19:13.7: green lotus, red lotus, and white lotus grow in the water, rest on the surface
cnd19:13.8: of the water, sink and grow underwater; some ...are born in the water and grow
cnd19:13.9: in the water, and live on the same height (as the surface); some ...rise above
cnd19:13.10: the water and live and dwell without being stained by water. Similarly, when the
cnd19:13.11: Blessed One observes the world with the eyes of the Buddha, he sees those with
cnd19:13.12: less dust and more dust; ... [DN.14]. The Blessed One knows: "This person is a
cnd19:13.13: greedy person, this person is an abusive person, this person is a foolish
cnd19:13.14: person, this person is a pathfinder, this person is a believer, and this person
cnd19:13.15: is a wise person." The Blessed One speaks to the greedy people, the Blessed One
cnd19:13.16: informs those who hate walkers of the practice of compassion, the Blessed One
cnd19:13.17: makes them settled in recitation, questioning, hearing of the Dhamma at the
cnd19:13.18: right time, discussion of the Dhamma at the right time, and co-living with
cnd19:13.19: teachers. The Blessed One informs the person who seeks the path, the Blessed One
cnd19:13.20: tells those who believe in confidence: the good sense of Buddha, the good nature
cnd19:13.21: of the Dhamma, the good practice of the Saṅgha and his precepts. The Blessed One
cnd19:13.22: teaches vipassanā to those who are wise practitioners: impermanence, suffering,
cnd19:14.1: "If you stand on the top of a rocky mountain,
cnd19:14.2: You can see all the people around,
cnd19:14.3: Similarly, those who are virtuous and all-seeing
cnd19:14.4: Climbed up the tall building of Dhamma.
cnd19:14.5: Those who are gone away, looking at people
cnd19:14.6: Who are in sorrow, conquered by birth and old age.
cnd19:14.7: Please get up! Heroes! Victors on the battlefield! Caravan leaders!
cnd19:14.8: Debt-free people, walk in the world,
cnd19:14.9: Blessed One! Please teach the Dhamma!
cnd19:14.10: There will be those who understand."
cnd19:15.1: How does the Blessed One regard all eyes as having eyes? All eyes are called the
cnd19:15.2: state all knowing wisdom. The Blessed One arrives (has), fully arrives (has),
cnd19:15.3: enters, fully enters, has enough, has all the state wisdom of knowing.
cnd19:16.1: "For him, there is nothing unseen here (in this world),
cnd19:16.2: There is no knowledge that cannot be known,
cnd19:16.3: He proves that everything that exists should be guided by inference,
cnd19:16.4: Because the Tathāgata, like that, is all-eyes."

cnd19:30.1: "Please observe that the world is empty": "The world," the world of hell, the
cnd19:30.2: animal world, the world of evil spirits, the world of man, the world of heaven,
cnd19:30.3: the world of aggregates, the world of realms, the world of living, this world,
cnd19:30.4: other worlds, the Brahma world, the heavenly world; this is called the world A
cnd19:30.5: certain bhikkhu said to the Blessed One [SN.35.82]: "Great Virtue! What is
cnd19:30.6: called 'World, the world,' Great Virtue! What is called 'World?'" "Bhikkhu!
cnd19:30.7: 'Broken,' so it is called 'World.' And what is 'broken?' Bhikkhu! The eye is
cnd19:30.8: broken, form is broken, eye consciousness is broken, eye contact is broken, and
cnd19:30.9: all that arises from this eye contact is either happiness or suffering, or
cnd19:30.10: neither suffering nor happiness is also broken. Ear ...(omitted); smell ...;
cnd19:30.11: taste ...; the body is broken, touch is broken...; Dhamma is broken,
cnd19:30.12: consciousness is dissipated, and mental touch is dissipated. Any happiness,
cnd19:30.13: suffering, or unpleasantness that arises from this mind is also dissipated.
cnd19:30.14: Bhikkhu! 'Broken,' so it is called 'The world.'"
cnd19:31.1: "Please observe that the world is empty": Observe that the world is empty for
cnd19:31.2: two reasons: because of the consideration of not going on freely or the
cnd19:31.3: consideration of being empty. How to observe that the world is empty due to the
cnd19:31.4: consideration of not going on? The freedom in form cannot be obtained, the
cnd19:31.5: freedom in feeling cannot be obtained, ...in thinking..., ...in action..., and
cnd19:31.6: the freedom in consciousness cannot be obtained. This was said by the Blessed
cnd19:32.1: "Bhikkhus! Form is without self, bhikkhus, because if this form is me, this form

cnd19:34.9: mind and form as condition, there are six sense bases; there is contact with the

cnd19:34.12: the living, predestined conditions arise from old age, death, sorrow,
cnd19:34.13: bitterness, suffering, worry, and despair.' This is the collection of the entire

cnd19:40.1: This was said by the Blessed One [SN.22.33]: "Bhikkhus! Whatever is not you, you
cnd19:40.2: must give up! If you give up it, it will be of long-term benefit and happiness
cnd19:40.3: for you. And, bhikkhus! What form not yours? Bhikkhus! What is not yours, you
cnd19:40.4: let it go! Let it go, it will have long-term benefits and happiness for you;
cnd19:40.5: feeling..., thinking..., doing..., if they don't know you, let it go! Let it go,
cnd19:40.6: .... Bhikkhus! Do you think in this forest, people will take away grass,
cnd19:40.7: fuel wood, branches, leaves, or burn it, or do what he wants, you will think
cnd19:40.8: like this: 'People take us, or burn it, or do what he wants?' 'No, Great Virtue!
cnd19:40.9: What's the reason for that? Great Virtue! Because this is not me, nor what I
cnd19:40.10: belong to.' 'Similarly, Bhikkhus! Whatever is not yours, you must give up! Give
cnd19:40.11: it away, .... And, bhikkhus! What is not yours? ....'"

cnd19:41.9: consciousness..., intention...; Ānanda, because 'I' or 'my being' is empty, it

cnd19:50.1: "After removing the view of self": "The view of self" is known as the twenty
cnd19:50.2: grounds of seeing. Here, the ordinary people who have not heard of the Holy One,
cnd19:50.3: have never seen the saints, those who are not proficient in the Dhamma, and have
cnd19:50.4: not been trained in the Dhamma; they have never seen the Dhamma of good people,
cnd19:50.5: are unskilled in the Dhamma, and have not been trained in the good Dhamma. They
cnd19:50.6: think that form is self, or 'I' have form, or form is in 'me,' or 'I' am in
cnd19:50.8: views, evil views, jungle (entangled) views, desert (barren) views, distorted
cnd19:50.9: views, shaken views, and bound views, they hold, accept, cling to, evil ways,
cnd19:50.10: evil path, evil nature, the place where the outer path rests, the clasp of
cnd19:50.11: inversion (vipariyesa), the clasp of inversion (viparīta), the clasp of
cnd19:50.12: inversion (vipallāsa), the clasp of evil, (seeing) as true the non-true, all
cnd19:50.13: come to the reach of the sixty-two evil views, this is seeing the view of self.
cnd19:50.14: "After removing the view of self": After removal of the self-view, after
cnd19:50.15: eradication, after disconnection, after pulling out, after complete removal,
cnd19:50.16: after abandoning, after expelling, after finishing, making it go to
cnd19:51.1: "In this way, you can overcome death": In this way, you can save yourself from
cnd19:51.2: birth, you can save yourself from aging, you can save yourself from death, you
cnd19:51.3: can transcend, you can pass, you can surpass, you can overcome.

cnd19:53.1: "The king of death cannot see": Death is the king of death; demons are also the

cnd19:53.3: not found, not gotten. This was said by the Blessed One [MN.25]:

cnd19:54.6: and unwholesome dhamma, and happiness and joy after being separated. First
cnd19:54.7: jhāna, Bhikkhus! This is called the bhikkhu blinding the demon. After killing
cnd19:54.8: the demon's eyes, the demon enters a state of not seeing and footlessness

cnd19:60.1: Besides, bhikkhus! After the bhikkhu transcends all neither thinking nor

cnd19:61.1: At the end of these verses... "The Blessed One is my teacher, I am a disciple."
